subject: Sexual Health
title: Nutrition During Puberty
description: A micro-lesson that makes Nutrition During Puberty usable.

hook.text: Puberty demands more calories, calcium, iron, and protein than almost any other period of life.

buildup.text: Calcium needs peak at 1,300 mg daily during puberty because bones are growing faster than ever before.

discovery.text: Iron needs increase, especially for girls after menstruation begins, to replace monthly blood loss.

twist.text: Many teens skip meals or eat nutrient-poor foods, risking deficiencies during this critical growth window.

climax.text: Proper nutrition during puberty builds the bone density and body composition that lasts a lifetime.

punchline.text: Feed the growth. What you eat now shapes your adult body.

quiz.question: How much calcium do teens need daily during puberty?
